correctResponse: Great Job! Let's try the next one
incorrectResponse: Nice try, but missed. Let's try again
completionQuote: You, have just completed this level.

questions.q: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
questions.backgroundStory: Albert Einstein, one of the greatest minds of our time, once said, “Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we now know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.”

questions.q: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.
questions.backgroundStory: H. L. Mencken once said, “Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.”

questions.q: The most exciting phrase to hear in science is not ‘Eureka!’
questions.backgroundStory: Isaac Asimov once said, “The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds new discoveries, is not ‘Eureka!’ but ‘That’s funny…’”

questions.q: I told my father I had to try political science for a year.
questions.backgroundStory: Paul Wolfowitz once said, “I told my father I had to try political science for a year. He thought I was throwing my life away.”

questions.q: I have seen firsthand that agricultural science has enormous potential to increase the yields of small farmers and lift them out of hunger and poverty.
